main_definition: To have enough resources, such as money or time, to be able to buy or do something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To have sufficient financial means to purchase an item or service.
meanings_and_examples.example: I can afford a new laptop since I've saved enough money.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be able to do something without difficulty due to having the necessary resources.
meanings_and_examples.example: After getting two extra shifts, I could afford to go on vacation this month.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having enough time or ability to undertake an activity or task.
meanings_and_examples.example: Afforded me the opportunity to complete my master's degree due to generous scholarships and flexible work hours.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be within a certain range of possibility or likelihood, often used in context with probability or availability.
meanings_and_examples.example: It is afforded that there will be traffic on the road during rush hour.
